body_html:
I think chaining so many ops will be prohibitively slow; it might be faster to just use py_func and scipy, etc.

I was adding an ImageAffineTransform op to implement rotations, but I'll add extra parameters to support general projective transforms. I'll add a tf.contrib.image.rotate function, and probably also expose a tf.contrib.image.projective_transform function where you can pass in the parameters for any transform.

That seems to cover most of the cases in the linked BVLC/caffe#2252, once we support different size/padding modes for the output. If it's not possible to implement the noise policies described there with tf.random_* plus a couple of extra ops, then we might want to add noise ops too in tf.contrib.image.

body:
I think chaining so many ops will be prohibitively slow; it might be faster to just use py_func and scipy, etc.

I was adding an ImageAffineTransform op to implement rotations, but I'll add extra parameters to support general projective transforms. I'll add a tf.contrib.image.rotate function, and probably also expose a tf.contrib.image.projective_transform function where you can pass in the parameters for any transform.

That seems to cover most of the cases in the linked BVLC/caffe#2252, once we support different size/padding modes for the output. If it's not possible to implement the noise policies described there with tf.random_\* plus a couple of extra ops, then we might want to add noise ops too in tf.contrib.image.
